description:
This course covers everything you need to contribute meaningfully to existing open-source software projects.

This course is taught by James Pearce (https://github.com/jamesgpearce). He is the former Head of Open Source at Meta, the company that invented React, Hack, and PyTorch, along with 100s of other popular projects. After 10+ years at Facebook (Meta), James became an expert instructor at joinTaro.com and created his own open source project, TinyBase: https://github.com/tinyplex/tinybase. Watch the interview with James here: https://youtu.be/D3WGcLyFvaY.

Slides can be found here: https://www.jointaro.com/course/become-an-open-source-master/

Watch other courses from Taro at https://www.joinTaro.com/courses/

⭐️ Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00:00) Course Introduction
⌨️ (0:05:42) Instructor + Outcomes
⌨️ (0:09:46) What is Open Source?
⌨️ (0:14:10) Projects, Repos, Issues, Pull Requests
⌨️ (0:19:06) The Benefits Of Open Source
⌨️ (0:26:33) The Right Reason To Do Open Source
⌨️ (0:32:27) Imp
title: Contributing To Open Source – Beginner's Guide
